metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6855 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Eye of GNOME (aka eog) 3.16.5, 3.17.x, 3.18.x before 3.18.3, 3.19.x, and 3.20.x before 3.20.4, when used with glib before 2.44.1, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write and crash) via vectors involving passing invalid UTF-8 to GMarkup.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eog - 3.10.2-0ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eog package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.2-0ubuntu5.2').
